result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole L. Pederson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today.
Concurrent with: 15CM178

miscConds.notes: $263.50 fine/cost to be paid to Clerk of Court Office by way of payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing on July 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full for attorneys fees. Bond to be applied to fine and attorney fees.

Must comply with Mental Health Regimen.   Must provide DNA sample with no surcharge.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.

Concurrent with: 15CM178
